error.signature: Node not ready: kubelet stopped posting node status

verdict.summary: Node transitions to NotReady when kubelet stops posting status updates, typically due to kubelet crash, networking issues, or resource exhaustion on the node.

dead_ends.action: Force-delete all pods on the node
dead_ends.why_fails: Pods are a symptom — the node itself is unhealthy and new pods will also fail

dead_ends.action: Just wait for auto-recovery without investigation
dead_ends.why_fails: Some causes (disk full, OOM) won't self-heal — need manual intervention

workarounds.action: SSH into the node and check kubelet: systemctl status kubelet && journalctl -u kubelet --since '5 min ago'
workarounds.how: Look for OOM kills, certificate expiry, or container runtime failures in kubelet logs

workarounds.action: Check node resource pressure: kubectl describe node <name> for MemoryPressure, DiskPressure, PIDPressure conditions

leads_to.condition: when workloads are evicted and insufficient capacity on other nodes

preceded_by.condition: when many OOMKilled pods exhaust node memory

frequently_confused_with.distinction: k8s-node-not-ready focuses on kubelet-stopped-posting scenarios, while node-not-ready covers the general NotReady condition
